title: Uber expands settlement with U.S. FTC related to cyberattack
text:
April 12, 2018 / 3:35 PM / Updated 4 minutes ago Uber expands settlement with U.S. FTC related to cyberattack Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The U.S. Federal Trade Commission said on Thursday the ride-hailing company Uber Technologies Inc had agreed to expand its proposed settlement with the agency over charges it deceived consumers about its privacy and data security practices. FILE PHOTO: Employees work inside Uber's Centre of Excellence office in Cairo, Egypt October 10, 2017. REUTERS/Amr Abdallah Dalsh/File Photo 
The FTC said the expansion of the proposed settlement comes after the commission learned Uber had failed to disclose a “significant” breach of consumer data that occurred in 2016 and would compel Uber to disclosure future incidents. Reporting by Tim Ahmann; Editing by David Alexander
